phrases.phrase: This is a test bbcode button
Enter default width for Accordion bbcode. Unit is defined below.
Enter max width for Accordion bbcode. Unit is pixel.
Choose which easing effect to use with the slides. Here's a website which might help you to choose . Default value: easeOutQuad.
Slide Max Height. Unit is pixel. Do not enter "px" !

Do you want Accordion Menu Titles to be displayed without any font styles? If this option is set to 'no', just use standard bbcodes (bold, italic, etc.) to customize the Title.

Example:
[accordion]
{slide=[SIZE=6]Title 1[/SIZE]}Slide 1 Content{/slide}
{slide=Title 2}Slide 2 Content{/slide}
[/accordion]

If the above option is set on 'no', the title of slide 1 will be displayed with a bigger font. If the option is set on 'yes', then only the raw title (without font styles) will be displayed.
[Accordion BBcode - Slides] Menu Titles Default Align
Default Align for Slides Menu Titles. This setting can be overridden by user in Slide 'slave tag' options. Example : {slide=Title|right}Content{/slide}.
[Images BBcode] Do you want to use the Yellow Picture?

Important
With the default XenForo configuration, if a visitor or a member in a forum can't download the forum attachments, it won't be able to see a picture uploaded in that forum. It's logical but this will break your message layout generating an html error because the image is not found.

You've got three solutions to fix that:
1) Give access visitors and members to the attachments. I don't like this.
2) Use the "Yellow picture option", which will display a yellow picture with a legend warning the user he doesn't have access to the image.
3) Use this following addon: "Image Attachment Optimization & CDN Support" (author: Tinhte). No matter his attachment permission, the user will be able to see the picture. This is the best solution in my opinion. If you select that option, don't use the 'Yellow Picture'.
The developer Mode will use the source of the Javascript (unminified).

Enter the default width that should be used with text box bbcode if user doesn't specify any option or if the given option is above the max width. Unit is defined below.
(Default value: 20)

Enter max width for text box bbcode. Unit is percentage. Do not enter "%" !
(Default value: 80)

Enter max width for text box bbcode. Unit is pixel. Do not enter "px" !
(Default value: 750)

Enter the default width that should be used with fieldset bbcode if user doesn't specify any option or if the given option is above the max width. Unit is defined below.
(Default value: 90)

Enter max width for the fieldset bbcode. Unit is percentage. Do not enter "%" !
(Default value: 100)

Enter max width for the fieldset bbcode. Unit is pixel. Do not precise "px" !
(Default value: 800)

Gview BBcode height can only be set up here (not in bbcode options). Unit is pixel. Do not precise "px" !
(Default value: 780)

Do you want to wrap the [gview] bbcode result inside the [spoiler] bbcode of your forum? That [spoiler] bbcode must support to have an option to be able to customize its title.
If you select this option, the width of the [gview] bbcode MUST be in pixels.

Gview BBcode width can only be set up here (not in bbcode options). Unit is defined below
(Default value: 600)

Enter the default width that should be used with image bbcodes if user doesn't specify any option or if the given option is above the max width. Unit is pixel. Do not precise "px" !
(Default value: 180)

Enter max width for images bbcodes. Unit is pixel. Do not enter "px" !
(Default value: 750)
This option will load on pages with the editor the main MarkItUp Javascript file (very light: 2ko). If you don't use the MarkItUp integrator for XenForo, you can switch this option to "no".

Enter the default width that should be used with bbcode bbcode if user doesn't specify any option or if the given option is above the max width. Unit is defined below.
(Default value: 90)

If you want to apply a latex command to all your latex codes, insert it here. For example:
1) \reverse\opaque\large
2) \blue\Large
3) {\color{Blue} }

Note: All Latex commands will not work here, only Mimextex commands will work.
(Default value is blank)

Enter the full path to the 'mimetex.cgi' script. The default external URL will work but if you want to install mimetex on your server, please see here: www.forkosh.com
(Default value: http://www.forkosh.com/mimetex.cgi)
Latex box Max Height. Once reached, the latex box will use an overflow.Unit is pixel. Do not enter "px" !

Enter max width for the latex bbcode. Unit is percentage. Do not enter "%" !
(Default value: 90)

Enter max width for the latex bbcode. Unit is pixel. Do not precise "px" !
(Default value: 800)
Modif TinyMCE editors in the admin side too?
Some addons might use customized version of TinyMCE inside the Admin Control Panel. Select yes to try to load Javascripts, css and any modifications needed.
Uncheck this option if you want to prevent users to automatically start a slideshow.
Default height in pixels for the Slider Bb Code. Default value: 200

Enter default width for Slider Bb Code. Default value is 400
Unit is defined below.
Default Slides Interval in milliseconds. Default value: 3000 (ms).
Maximum Slides Interval in milliseconds. Default value: 30000 (ms).
Minimum Slides Interval in milliseconds. Default value: 300 (ms).
Max height in pixels for the Slider Bb Code. Default value: 700
Max width in pixels for Slider Bb Code. Default value: 860
Choose which easing effect to use with the slides. Here's a website which might help you to choose . Default value: easeOutQuad.
Default height in pixels for the tabs Bb Code. Default value: 200

Enter default width for Tabs bbcode. Default value is 400
Unit is defined below.
Max height in pixels for the tabs Bb Code. Default value: 600
Max width in pixels for the tabs Bb Code. Default value: 750
Activate this option to make full-width characters (Chinese/Japanese) compatible with Bb Codes Options Command. Ie: [bimg=]url[/bimg] (instead of [bimg=100px]url[/bimg]).
[Bb Codes & Buttons Manager] Advanced Bb Codes
Options for the Advanced BBcodes Addon

Do you want to automatically start slideshow once page loaded? Activate this option is recommended to avoid a Picasa Slideshow problem which is to open the Picasa Album page when you press the start button. Default: yes

Please note that this option won't solve this start button problem once the slideshow has no more image to display (once ended, the start button will be automatically displayed). No loop option is available.
Default height of the Slideshow or Picasa image. Default value: 400
What is the default delay interval between images? Default: Picasa default
Default width of the Slideshow or Picasa image. Default value: 600

The Picasa Slideshow is using the RSS link of an album to display its images. But most of the time users don't really know how to get this RSS link and just paste the album URL. This BB Code will automatically grab the RSS link looking inside the album html page PROVIDING your server can support it.

There are two way of doing it. The normal PHP method is to use the function 'file_get_contents', but with Shared Hosting this function is often disabled or can't work because 'allow_url_fopen' is not allowed. You can use instead cURL method if this library is installed on your server.

The above list will tell you which methods is supported by your server. If none of these two methods is available, you must choose 'Manual RSS Linking'. Your users will then have to enter themselves the direct RSS link. Default value: 'Manual RSS Linking'
The embed code has a language attribute, but it seems the Picassa Slideshow doesn't take it into account. Default: en_US

Max height of the Slideshow or Picasa image. If users specify the width/height in the tag options, which should be the Max height not to go over? If the specified width is above this limit, the default height will be apply. Default value: 533
What is the maximum delay interval between images? Default: 15 seconds

Max width of the Slideshow or Picasa image. If users specify the width/height in the tag options, which should be the Max width not to go over? If the specified width is above this limit, the default width will be apply. Default value: 800
Returns picasa icon if no view permission?

If users have no Bb Code view permissions, instead of returning a standard message you can choose to return a small Picasa icon. This icon will be linked to the url entered between the picasa tags (providing it's an url).
Tag content (Optional, should normally be empty)
Insert a text box with a float position
Insert a fieldset with a custom title
Picasa BBcode files are not on the server, please contact website administrator.
(Move your mouse to the spoiler area to reveal the content)
To use a caption, click here
When using a float block, this block element (bbcode) must be inserted before the text block.
This text box is a float element, so to display correctly it must be inserted before the main text block
Sorry, you don't have access to the image
The URL you're using seems to be a direct link to a Picasa Album, please use instead its RSS link.
The Picasa Image URL has some problems
The URL doesn't seem to come from Picasa
Impossible to find the RSS link
You are supposed to use a Picasa URL with this BB Code and more precisely a RSS Album link.
You're not authorised to see the Picasa content
No permission to display the image
If you use the '\reverse' Mimetex Latex command, you might need to set a border here.
P.S: The "inner" layout (when the buttons are all inside the slider) has its own padding
This title layout is triggered with the "top" or "bottom" commands ("slide" slave tag)
Configure only the font color here, this would avoid to break any layouts.
Configure only the font color here, this would avoid to break any layouts.
Configure only the font color here, this would avoid to break any layouts.
Highlight all normal tags [tag]...[/tag]. Example: [article]content[/article] or [article=option1]content[/article]
Highlight all normal tags [tag]...[/tag]. Example: [article]content[/article] or [article=option1]content[/article]

Highlight all {tag}...{/tags} in bbcode options. For example:
[article={b}Title{/b}]content[/article]

Highlight all {tag}...{/tags} in bbcode options. For example:
[article={b}Title{/b}]content[/article]
[tag=100|The previous sign was a separator]content[/tag]. Note: for the picasa bbcode, the separator will be a coma.
Change this value only if you get problems with your style. Default value: 248px
Change this value only if you get problems with your style. Default value: 252px
Change this value only if you get problems with your style. Default value: 210px
Change this value only if you get problems with your style. Default value: 252px
Change this value only if you get problems with your style. Default value: 252px
Change this value only if you get problems with your style. Default value: 223px
Do not change this value, except if you're using a translation of this addon and you're having display problems with the 'Title' field (normal state). Default value: 35px.
Do not change this value, except if you're using a translation of this addon and you're having display problems once the 'Title' field is stretched. Default value: 320px.
Do not change this value, except if you're using a translation of this addon and you're having display problems with the 'Url' field. Default value: 300px.
Do not change this value, except if you're using a translation of this addon and you're having display problems with the 'Width' field. Default value: 35px.
[Bb Codes & Buttons Manager] Advanced Bb Codes (2/2)
[Bb Codes & Buttons Manager] Advanced Bb Codes (1/2)

property.title: Normal Tags Highlighting [OPEN]
property.description: Highlight all normal tags [tag]...[/tag]. Example: [article]content[/article] or [article=option1]content[/article]

property.title: Special Tags Highlighting [OPEN]
property.description:
Highlight all {tag}...{/tags} in bbcode options. For example:
[article={b}Title{/b}]content[/article]

property.title: Special Tags Highlighting [CONTENT]
property.description: Highlight content of {tag}...{/tags}

property.title: Normal Tags Highlighting [OPTIONS]
property.description: Highlight options of [tag=OPTIONS]...[/tag]

property.title: Normal Tags Highlighting [CLOSE]
property.description: Highlight all normal tags [tag]...[/tag]. Example: [article]content[/article] or [article=option1]content[/article]

property.title: Special Tags Highlighting [CLOSE]
property.description:
Highlight all {tag}...{/tags} in bbcode options. For example:
[article={b}Title{/b}]content[/article]

property.title: [LATEX] Img
property.description: If you use the '\reverse' Mimetex Latex command, you might need to set a border here.

property.title: Editor Pop-up Stretched 'Title' field width
property.description: Do not change this value, except if you're using a translation of this addon and you're having display problems once the 'Title' field is stretched. Default value: 320px.

property.title: Editor Pop-up Normal 'Title' field width
property.description: Do not change this value, except if you're using a translation of this addon and you're having display problems with the 'Title' field (normal state). Default value: 35px.

property.title: Editor Pop-up 'Width' field width
property.description: Do not change this value, except if you're using a translation of this addon and you're having display problems with the 'Width' field. Default value: 35px.

property.title: Editor Pop-up 'Url' field width
property.description: Do not change this value, except if you're using a translation of this addon and you're having display problems with the 'Url' field. Default value: 300px.

property.title: Accordion popup height
property.description: Change this value only if you get problems with your style. Default value: 248px

\fontsize{2} {xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_template_latex_help_desc_fontsize}

+ {xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_template_latex_help_desc_addition} 1+2

\frac...{} {xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_template_latex_help_desc_frac1} \frac 1{2}
\frac...{} {xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_template_latex_help_desc_frac2} \frac 1{2+x^2}
\left(...\right) {xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_template_latex_help_desc_brackets} \left( \frac 1{2+x^2} \right)

<xen:set var="$miudatas"> data-normal-width="{xen:property adv_template_normaltitlefield_width}" data-streched-width="{xen:property adv_template_stretchedtitlefield_width}" data-auto="{xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_template_auto}" data-bimgid="{xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_button_bimg_new_id}" </xen:set> </xen:include>

<xen:include template="editor_dialog_fast_adv_picasa"> <xen:set var="$miu">isMiu</xen:set>
<xen:set var="$miudatas"> data-normal-width="{xen:property adv_template_normaltitlefield_width}" data-streched-width="{xen:property adv_template_stretchedtitlefield_width}" data-auto="{xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_template_auto}" </xen:set> </xen:include>

<xen:require css="sedo_adv_accordion.css" />
<xen:if is="{$xenOptions.AdvBBcodeBar_debug_devmode}"> <xen:require js="js/sedo/advtoolbar/src/advbar_allinone.src.js" /> <xen:else /> <xen:require js="js/sedo/advtoolbar/advbar_allinone.js" /> </xen:if>
<xen:if is="{$options.slides}"> <dl id="{$options.uniqid}" class="adv_accordion {$options.blockAlign}" data-easing="{$xenOptions.AdvBBcodeBar_accordion_slides_easing_effect}" data-duration="{$xenOptions.AdvBBcodeBar_accordion_slides_easing_duration}" style="display:block;width:{$options.width}{$options.widthType};" > <xen:foreach loop="$options.slides" value="$slide" i="$i" count="$total"> <xen:set var="$slideClass"><xen:if is="{$i} == 1">first<xen:elseif is="{$i} == {$total}" />last<xen:else />between</xen:if></xen:set> <dt class="{$slideClass} {xen:if '{$slide.class_open}','{$slide.class_open}'}" style="text-align:{$slide.align};"> {xen:if '{$slide.title}', '{xen:raw $slide.title}', '{xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_text_slide}{$i}'} </dt> <dd class="{$slideClass} {xen:if '{$slide.open}','{$slide.open}'} {xen:if '{$slide.class_open}','{$slide.class_open}'}" {xen:if '{$slide.height}', 'style="height:{$slide.height}px;overflow-x:hidden;overflow-y:auto;"'}>{xen:raw $slide.content} </dd> </xen:foreach> </dl> <xen:else /> no slide </xen:if>

{xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_text_article} {$content}
{xen:if '{$options.sourceText}', '{xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_text_source} '}{xen:raw $options.source}
{xen:if '{$options.sourceText}', '{xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_text_source} '}{xen:raw $options.source}

{xen:raw $options.caption.text}
{xen:raw $options.caption.text}
{xen:raw $options.caption.text}
{xen:raw $options.caption.text}
 {xen:if '!{$visitor.permissions.forum.viewAttachment} AND {$xenOptions.AdvBBcodeBar_bimg_yellowpic}', '{xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_text_notmember}', '{xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_text_clicktoexpand}'}

{xen:if '{$options.title}', '{xen:raw $options.title}', '{xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_text_encadre}'}
{xen:raw $content}
{xen:if '{$options.title}', '{xen:raw $options.title}', '{xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_text_encadre}'}
{xen:raw $content}

For Internet Explorer 6&7
{xen:if '{$options.title}', '{xen:raw $options.title}', '{xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_fieldset_title}'} {xen:raw $content}
For all others IE > Legend Fix: if value in px, use the pixels width, otherwise use 100% > AdvFieldsetTrigger class calls a Jquery script that will fix the legend width if its bigger than then fieldset width (should occur only if fieldset width is in percentage) The Jquery fix just get the real width of the block [.width()] and apply it to the legend (only if legend width is bigger than block width)
{xen:if '{$options.title}', '{xen:raw $options.title}', '{xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_fieldset_title}'}
 {xen:raw $content}
"Normal" browsers
{xen:if '{$options.title}', '{xen:raw $options.title}', '{xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_fieldset_title}'} {xen:raw $content}
<xen:require css="sedo_adv_gview.css" /> <iframe class="adv_gview" src="https://docs.google.com/viewer?{xen:raw $content}" width="{$options.width}" height="{$options.height}"></iframe>
{xen:raw $options.title}

{xen:phrase sedo_adv_picasa_error_rss_not_found} {xen:phrase sedo_adv_picasa_error_not_picasa_url} {xen:phrase sedo_adv_picasa_error_dont_use_direct_link} {xen:phrase sedo_adv_picasa_error_use_picasa_url} {xen:phrase sedo_adv_picasa_error_img_problem} {xen:phrase sedo_adv_picasa_error_unknown} {xen:phrase sedo_adv_picasa_logo_text} {xen:phrase sedo_adv_picasa_error_not_url} {xen:phrase sedo_adv_picasa_noperms}

{xen:raw $slide.title}
{xen:if '{$slide.canViewImage}', '{xen:phrase sedo_adv_loading}', '{xen:phrase sedo_adv_slider_img_noperms}'}
{xen:if '{$slide.canViewImage}', ''}
{xen:raw $slide.content}
{$i}

<xen:comment>
	WRAPPER
</xen:comment>

.adv_slider_wrapper {
	{xen:property advbbcodebar_slider_container}
}

.adv_slider_wrapper.inner {
	padding: 5px;
}

.adv_slider_wrapper.bleft {
	margin-left :0 !important;
	margin-right: auto !important;
}

.adv_slider_wrapper.bcenter {
	margin-left: auto !important;
	margin-right: auto !important;
}

.adv_slider_wrapper.bright {
	margin-left:auto !important;
	margin-right:0 !important;
}

.adv_slider_wrapper.fleft {
	float: left;
	margin: 1px 10px 0 0 !important;
}

.adv_slider_wrapper.fright {
	float: right;
	margin: 1px 0 0 10px !important;
}

<xen:comment>
	SLIDES
</xen:comment>

.advslides {
	{xen:property advbbcodebar_slider_slides}
}

.advslides > div {
	display: none;
	position: absolute;
	top: 0;
	left: 0;
	margin: 7px;
	padding: 15px;
	overflow: auto;
}

.advslides > div.active {
	position: relative !important;
}

.advslides > div.inner {
	padding: 10px 40px;
}

.advslides > div.imageMode {
	position:absolute !important;
	padding: 0;
	margin: 0;
	overflow:hidden;
}

.advslides .adv_slide_mask {
	display:block;
	position:relative;
	width:100%;
	height:100%;
	background-color:black;
	z-index:40;
}

.advslides .adv_slide_mask span {
	display:block;
	padding:20px;
	color:white;
}

<xen:comment>
	SLIDE TITLE
</xen:comment>
.advslides .adv_slides_title {
	{xen:property advbbcodebar_slider_slides_title}
}

.advslides .adv_slides_title_abs {
	{xen:property advbbcodebar_slider_slides_title_abs}
}

.advslides .adv_slides_title_abs.bottom{
	bottom:0;
}

.inner .advslides .adv_slides_title_abs.bottom{
	bottom:36px !important;
}

.inner .advslides .adv_slides_title_abs.bottom_num{
	bottom:20px !important;
}

.advslides .adv_slides_title_abs span {
	display: block;
	padding: 10px 15px;
}
<xen:comment>
	TABS
</xen:comment>

.advslidestabs {
	text-align:center;
	position: relative;
}

.advslidestabs.inner_bullet {
	bottom: 38px;
}

.advslidestabs.outside_bullet {
	bottom: 5px;
}

.advslidestabs.inner_num {
	bottom: 22px;
}

.advslidestabs.outside_num {
	bottom: 0;
}

.advslidestabs.inner_bullet.imageMenu,
.advslidestabs.inner_num.imageMenu {
	background-color: rgba(0,0,0,0.7);

	margin-right: -3px;
}

.advslidestabs a:active, .advslidestabs a:hover, .advslidestabs a:focus {
	box-shadow:none !important;
	outline:none !important;
	background:none !important;
}

.advslidestabs a {
	display:inline;
	{xen:property advbbcodebar_slider_tabs}
}

.advslidestabs a.num {
	font-size: 12pt;
}

.advslidestabs a.bullet {
	font-size: 20pt !important;
}

.advslidestabs a:hover {
	{xen:property advbbcodebar_slider_tabs_hover}
}

.advslidestabs a:active,
.advslidestabs a.current {
	{xen:helper cssImportant, {xen:property advbbcodebar_slider_tabs_active}}
}

.advslidestabs a:visited {
	{xen:property advbbcodebar_slider_tabs}
}

<xen:comment>
	TABS COMMANDS (PLAY-PAUSE)
</xen:comment>
.advslidestabs .cmd{
	display: inline-block;
	position: relative;
	height: 14px;
	line-height: 11px;
	vertical-align: middle;
	cursor :pointer;
	color:#888888;
}

.advslidestabs .cmd:hover{
	color:#696969;
}

.advslidestabs.inner_bullet .cmd,
.advslidestabs.outside_bullet .cmd{
	top: -4px;
}

.advslidestabs.inner_num .cmd,
.advslidestabs.outside_num .cmd{
	top: -1px;
}

.advslidestabs .play{
	font-size: 7pt;
	margin-left: 10px;
}

.advslidestabs .pause{
	font-size: 5pt;
}

<xen:comment>
	NAVIG BUTTONS
</xen:comment>

.adv_slider_navig{
	position: relative;
	{xen:helper cssImportant, {xen:property advbbcodebar_slider_nav_buttons}}
}

.adv_slider_navig:hover{
	{xen:helper cssImportant, {xen:property advbbcodebar_slider_nav_buttons_hover}}
}

.adv_slider_navig:active{
	{xen:helper cssImportant, {xen:property advbbcodebar_slider_nav_buttons_active}}
}

.adv_backward{
	float: left;
	left: 8px;
}

.adv_forward{
	float: right;
	right: 8px;
	clear: right;
}

<xen:comment>
	NOT USED BUT KEPT FOR REFERENCE
	Disabled navigational button. Is not needed when tabs are
	configured with rotate: true
</xen:comment>

.disabled {
	visibility:hidden !important;
}

<xen:comment>
	NO SCRIPT
</xen:comment>

.adv_slider_wrapper.noscript{
	overflow:auto;
	border: 2px solid {xen:property primaryMedium};
}

.adv_slider_noscript {
	border: 1px solid {xen:property primaryMedium};
}

.adv_slider_noscript_title {
	font-size: 12px;
	font-weight:bold;
	color: {xen:property contentText};
	line-height: 30px;
	height: 30px;
	background: {xen:property primaryLightish} url('{xen:property imagePath}/xenforo/gradients/category-23px-light.png') repeat-x top;
}

.adv_slider_noscript_content {
	padding:5px;
	overflow: auto;
}

{xen:if '{$options.1}', '{xen:raw $options.1}', '{xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_text_spoiler}'}
{xen:raw $content}

{xen:calc '{$options.height}-({xen:property advbbcodebar_tabs_title.height}+{xen:property advbbcodebar_tabs_content.padding-top} + {xen:property advbbcodebar_tabs_content.padding-bottom})'}
  • {xen:if '{$tab.title}', '{xen:raw $tab.title}', '{xen:phrase Sedo_AdvBBcodeBar_text_tab}{$i}'}
    •
{xen:raw $pane.content}
<xen:require css="sedo_adv_xenhook_tinymce.css" />
